## Upcoming Events

  * ### [River Ballads, Artwork by Barbara Hocker](http://web.archive.org/web/20250428135403/https://ctrivermuseum.org/events/river-ballads-artwork-by-barbara-hocker/)

River Ballads, Artwork by Barbara Hocker March 18 – May 18, 2025 Barbara Hocker is a Connecticut artist inspired by her practice of Tai Chi to create books and encaustic prints that capture moments and details of nature by […]

  * ### [River Tales: Frog](http://web.archive.org/web/20250428135403/https://ctrivermuseum.org/events/frog/)

River Tales Saturday, May 3, 2025 11 am – 12 pm and 1 – 2 pm SIGN UP HERE! Non-members: $3 per learner Members: FREE! Museum admission is not included with ticket purchase. Swing by the Connecticut River Museum […]

  * ### [Spring Stuffed Animal Sleepover](http://web.archive.org/web/20250428135403/https://ctrivermuseum.org/events/spring-stuffed-animal-sleepover/)

Stuffie Drop-off: Saturday, May 3, 2025 2pm – 5pm Stuffie Pick-up: Sunday, May 4, 2025 10am – 5pm PURCHASE TICKETS HERE Connie the Connecticut River Serpent has a night of fun planned for her stuffed animal pals! Stop […]

collections_text:
## Featured Collection

## 

## **_Jetsam_**

**Class B Frostbite Dinghy**  
**Designed by Charles D. Mower (1875-1942)**  
**Ca. 1933**  
**Gift of Mark Ellis, 2021**

**Essex was the home of the first Eastern Frostbite Dinghy Regatta in March of 1933. A fleet of 23 Class A and B dinghies competed off the old Steamboat Dock._Jetsam_ represents the hardy spirit of those early Frostbite racers. **

## Featured Collection
